scenario:
Mountain View, Calif., March 18, 2025 - The tax return deadline is April 15, and experts advise filing as soon as possible due to confusion around IRS layoffs and uncertainty about new tax proposals. However, these proposals will not impact 2024 taxes, and the IRS will maintain essential operations throughout tax season. 

The average tax refund was over $3,000 last tax season, and current filing statistics show a 5.7% increase in refunds with an average amount of $3,324. Intuit's TurboTax provides a fast and stress-free tax filing solution, with thousands of TurboTax Live experts available to do taxes virtually or in person. 

Those who used TurboTax Full Service last season can work with the same expert again this year. The tax deadline is approaching, and Intuit advises not to wait and get taxes done now.
